issue.title: Improvements on withConsecutive with return

labels.name: type/enhancement
labels.description: A new idea that should be implemented

issue.title: Remove usages of with consecutive()

repository.name: aphiria
repository.description: A simple, extensible REST API framework for PHP

issue.body: [PHPUnit plans on deprecating `withConsecutive()` in version 10](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4564), and does not plan on giving an (easy) way of configuring a mock to return different values based on different parameters. This forces us to have to redo some tests or to switch to another library (eg Mockery) to accomplish this.

issue.title: Remove WithConsecutiveArgToArrayRector as various upgrade paths possible
issue.body:
This rule had an ambition to upgrade PHPUnit deprecation since PHPUnit 9 https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4564

There is no clear path, and it can result into not-working code. Instead this pieces should be changed manually depending on exact case.

Here are the sources that might help with that:

* https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/commit/dbba41d241cd40edca7f88f9ef42a38fb2455995 
* https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4255#issuecomment-636422439
* https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4026
* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10954107/phpunit-how-do-i-mock-multiple-method-calls-with-multiple-arguments/28045531#28045531

issue.title: Run builds with DBAL 4.0.x-dev
issue.body:
Relevant changes from DBAL 4.0.x:
1. https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/pull/3488
2. https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/pull/3569
3. https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/pull/3583

**TODO**:
- [x] Backport what's possible to 2.13.x and rebase: https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/9730
- [x] Address static analysis issues when testing against DBAL 3.4.x-dev.
- [x] ~~Why do discriminator maps have numeric keys despite their `<string,class-string>` type?~~ Known issue to be baselined.
- [x] Improve MySQL test suite compatibility with DBAL 4 (https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/9728).

**Improve DBAL upgrade path**:
- [x] Get https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/pull/5373 merged.
- [x] Get https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/pull/5377 merged.

**Next steps**:
1. https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/9735.
2. Test the build with `^4@dev` on PostgreSQL.
3. Run static analysis with `^4@dev`.
4. Bump DBAL version constraint to `^3.4` once it's released.

issue.title: Update PR 1751 + add tests, improve coverage.

repository.name: wordpress-develop
repository.description: WordPress Develop, Git-ified. Synced from git://develop.git.wordpress.org/, including branches and tags! This repository is just a mirror of the WordPress subversion repository. Please include a link to a pre-existing ticket on https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ with every pull request.

issue.body:
This PR expands on [PR 1754](https://github.com/WordPress/wordpress-develop/pull/1751) to:
- [x] bring PR 1754 in line with modern Core/Test standards including:
  - [x] improved test method descriptions.
  - [x] clearer test method names.
  - [x] `data_` prefixes for data providers per Trac 53119.
  - [x] `$message` parameters per [Core Handbook: Writing PHPUnit Tests - Using Assertions](https://make.wordpress.org/core/handbook/testing/automated-testing/writing-phpunit-tests/#using-assertions).
  - [x] line length limits for contributor a11y consideration.
  - [x] filter callbacks changed to closures + `static` where appropriate per [Core Handbook: Writing PHPUnit Tests - One-off Functions for Hooks](https://make.wordpress.org/core/handbook/testing/automated-testing/writing-phpunit-tests/#one-off-functions-for-hooks).
- [x] remove an unnecessary constant added to `tests/phpunit/includes/bootstrap.php` in [PR 1754](https://github.com/WordPress/wordpress-develop/pull/1751).
- [x] remove tests related to the Rollback feature, which is not yet committed.
  - These have also been updated with the above and retained in a separate branch for a later time.
- [x] add more tests/datasets.
- [x] remove a refactor that should be separated out into a different ticket/PR.

Line coverage is now 48.21% with `trunk`.

I believe this is as far as I can go for now with unit tests due to missing strings, a missing guard, and the use of general functions and the need to mock `WPDB` to ensure the tests are pure unit tests. Otherwise, integration tests can be added to cover the areas not covered by this PR.

Trac ticket: https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/54245

body:
withConsecutive() is now going from fully available in 9.5 to fully removed in 10.0, with no deprecation process in between to allow projects to react. Shall a deprecation be added to 9.5?

Also see https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/3306554

issue.title: Deprecate InvocationMocker::withConsecutive() in PHPUnit 9
issue.body:
| Q                   | A
| --------------------| ---------------
| PHPUnit version     | 10.0.0
| PHP version         | n/a
| Installation Method | n/a

#### Summary

#4564 has removed `InvocationMocker::withConsecutive()`. Initially it was meant to be deprecated in PHPUnit 10 for removal in PHPUnit 11, but then removal was moved forward.

Right now the method is fully supported in 9.5, and not at all in 10.

Can we have a deprecation in PHPUnit 9?

issue.title: 5.x: PHPUnit 10

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
I thought I would get a little further without creating a draft here but there is already so much I have to document so I don't forget something:

## data provider methods need to be static

I got most of that coverd in this PR but this creates a problem in the `EncryptedCookieMiddlewareTest::malformedCookies` where we use `$this->_encrypt('secret data', 'aes');` from the `CookieCryptTrait.php`
Suggestions?

## `->withConsecutive()` was removed
see https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4564 and https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4026#issuecomment-825453794 

The `->withConsecutive()` removal alone creates a massive load of changes because currently we have 57 usages of this method inside our tests.

I didn't look into that any further till now.

## Multiple methods have been removed without any replacement documentation

- `TestCase::getMockClass()`
- `TestCase::expectWarning()`
- `TestCase::expectWarningMessage()`
- `TestCase::expectWarningMessageMatches()`

and even more on the `Assert` class: https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4602

## `Testcase::run` now returns `void`

I only found the commit where it changed but no mention of why this was changed or how it should be replaced with.
https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/commit/77e60150c2185da760692277aeb2b337686b1f30#diff-6c939b18f9a1acd49fa0f01507a01ab61c419136f2d0b94e13fa4e13998389a0R19

We use that inside our [TestCaseTest::testSkipIf()](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/5.x/tests/TestCase/TestSuite/TestCaseTest.php#L110)

## Removed Hook System

See https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4595

Which we use in our [PHPUnitExtension](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/5.x/src/TestSuite/Fixture/PHPUnitExtension.php#L26)

issue.title: PHPUnit 9.6 misses deprecation warning for `withConsecutive()` removed in PHPUnit 10
issue.body:
| Q                   | A
| --------------------| ---------------
| PHPUnit version     | 9.6.3
| PHP version         | 8.1, 8.2
| Installation Method | Composer

#### Summary

We read about the changes in PHPUnit 10 and the removal of `withConsecutive()` + its alternatives (https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4564 and https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4026), so starting with a  smooth upgrade path for our projects by upgrading to PHPUnit 9.6 first seemed like a logical step. We expected to see deprecation warnings for `withConsecutive()`, as they have been deprecated in https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5063. After running the test suite with 9.6.3, there was no output to inform us about any deprecation, so it seems to me that there are no warnings for this method implemented yet, but I think there should be.

I'm interested in your thoughts on this. 

Btw, thanks for all the work you put into PHPUnit  :+1:

issue.title: [Tests] Remove occurrences of `withConsecutive()`
issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Branch?       | 5.4
| Bug fix?      | no
| New feature?  | no
| Deprecations? | no
| Tickets       | -
| License       | MIT
| Doc PR        | -

`withConsecutive()` has been deprecated in PHPUnit 9.6 and removed in PHP 10 (https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4564). This PR aims at starting the work to remove these occurrences. There is unfortunately no given migration path, and this requires manual work.

I'll create a meta issue referencing remaining occurrences if this one's merged, to keep track. Some seems pretty hard to remove.

cc @OskarStark this might interest you, as we worked a lot on tests lately
